intro: Dissochaeta hirsutoidea, commonly known as the hairy dissochaeta, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
